alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 11:33AM PDT until March 18 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR THE FAILURE OF LEVEE FAILURE ON THE PAJARO RIVER NEAR RIVER MILE 10 NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a levee failure continues. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Monterey. In northern California, Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until noon PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. This includes the city of Pajaro. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 AM PDT, flooding will continue due to a levee failure on the Pajaro River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Watsonville, Las Lomas and Pajaro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
